column4: hello, I have Ubuntu installed on a wide screen laptop. how can I configure xorg for wide screen ?
your resolutions are being constrained to something like 1024x768?
I'm using 10024 x 768 I haven't tried any other resolutions
if thats the case, a simple sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
basically just defaults until you reach resolution selection
I tried that but it is forcing me, it seems,  to use 1024 x 768
you selected the desired reses when u were doing dpkg-reconfig?
yes but the settings came out all wrong my screen started half the size with 640x480 I had to restore the backup
install read-edid package, pastebin the output of sudo get-edid | parse-edid
what command do I use to install read-edid ?
they are the ones that limit what reses you see I think
